arabicText: فَفَتَحْنَآ أَبْوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٍۢ مُّنْهَمِرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	opened	the	gates	of	heaven,	
with	water	flowing	furiously.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hum	ne	āasmān	ke	darwāze	khol	diye	
zor	ke	behte	pāni	se

arabicText: وَفَجَّرْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ عُيُونًۭا فَٱلْتَقَى ٱلْمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرٍۢ قَدْ قُدِرَ
englishTranslationText:
And	caused	springs	to	gush	out	from	the	
earth,	so	that	the	two	waters	met	totalling	
a	quantity	that	had	been	destined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zameen	chashme	karke	baha	dí	to	
donoñ	pāni	mil	gaye	us	miqdār	par	jo	
muqaddar	thi

arabicText: وَفَجَّرْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ عُيُونًۭا فَٱلْتَقَى ٱلْمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرٍۢ قَدْ قُدِرَ
englishTranslationText:
And	caused	springs	to	gush	out	from	the	
earth,	so	that	the	two	waters	met	totalling	
a	quantity	that	had	been	destined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zameen	chashme	karke	baha	dí	to	
donoñ	pāni	mil	gaye	us	miqdār	par	jo	
muqaddar	thi

arabicText: وَحَمَلْنَـٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَٰحٍۢ وَدُسُرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	carried	Nooh	upon	a	ship	of	
wooden	planks	and	nails.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hum	ne	Nūh	ko	sawār	kiya	takhtoñ	aur	
keeloñ	wāli	par.

arabicText: تَجْرِى بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَآءًۭ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
englishTranslationText:
Sailing	in	front	of	Our	sight;	as	a	reward	
for	the	sake	of	one	who	was	rejected.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	hamāri	nigah	ke	ru-baru	behti	uske	sile	
meiñ	jiske	sāth	kufr	kiya	gaya	tha

arabicText: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَـٰهَآ ءَايَةًۭ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	left	it	as	a	sign	–	so	is	there	one	
who	would	ponder?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hum	ne	usey	nishāni	chhoda	to	hai	koi	
dhiyān	karne	wāla

arabicText: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
englishTranslationText:
So	how	did	My	punishment	turn	out,	and	
My	threats?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kaisa	huwa	mera	‘aƶāb	aur	meri	
dhamkiyañ

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	indeed	made	the	Qur’an	
easy	to	memorise,	so	is	there	one	who	
would	remember?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hum	ne	Qur’ān	yād	karne	ke	
liye	āasān	farma	diya	to	hai	koi	yād	karne	
wāla

arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌۭ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
englishTranslationText:
The	tribe	of	A’ad	denied	–	so	how	did	My	
punishment	turn	out,	and	My	warnings?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āad	ne	jhutlaya	to	kaisa	huwa	mera	‘aƶāb		
aur	mere	dar	dilāne	ke	farmān

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًۭا صَرْصَرًۭا فِى يَوْمِ نَحْسٍۢ مُّسْتَمِرٍّۢ
englishTranslationText:
We	indeed	sent	towards	them	a	severe	
windstorm,	on	a	day	the	ill	luck	of	which	
lasted	upon	them	forever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	hum	ne	un	par	ek	sakht	āañdhi	
bheji	aise	din	meiñ	jiski	nahusat	un	par	
hamesha	ke	liye	rahi

arabicText: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍۢ مُّنقَعِرٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Smashing	down	men	as	if	they	were	uprooted	trunks	of	date	palms.
romanUrduTranslationText: Logoñ	ko	yuñ	de	mārti	thi	ke	goya	woh	ukhdi	huyi	khajooroñ	ke	dand	(Sookhe	tane)	haiñ

arabicText: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
englishTranslationText: So	how	did	My	punishment	turn	out,	and	My	warnings?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kaisa	huwa	mera	‘aƶāb		aur	dar	ke	farmān

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	We	have	indeed	made	the	Qur’an	easy	to	memorise,	so	is	there	one	who	would	remember?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak		hum	ne	āasān	kiya	Qur’ān	yād	karne	ke	liye	to	hai	koi	yād	karne	wāla.

arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
englishTranslationText: The	tribe	of	Thamud	denied	the	Noble	Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Samood	ne	Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlaya

arabicText: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَبَشَرًۭا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدًۭا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًۭا لَّفِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ وَسُعُرٍ
englishTranslationText: So	they	said,	“What!	Shall	we	follow	a	man	from	among	us?	If	we	do,	we	are	indeed	astray,	and	insane!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	bole	kya	hum	apne	meiñ	ke	ek	ādmi	ki	t’abedāri	kareñ	jab	to	hum	zaroor	gumrah	aur	deewāne	
haiñ

arabicText: أَءُلْقِىَ ٱلذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“What!	Of	all	the	men	among	us,	the	remembrance	has	come	down	upon	him?	In	fact,	he	is	a	
mischievous,	great	liar.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kya	hum	sab	meiñ	se	is	par	zikr	utāra	gaya	balke	yeh	sakht	jhoota	itrauna	(Shaikhi	bāz)	hai

arabicText: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًۭا مَّنِ ٱلْكَذَّابُ ٱلْأَشِرُ
englishTranslationText: It	was	said	to	Saleh,	“They	will	soon	realise	tomorrow	who	is	the	mischievous	great	liar.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bahut	jald	kal	jān	jāyeñ	ge	kaun	tha	badā	jhoota	itrauna	(Shaikhi	bāz).

arabicText: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةًۭ لَّهُمْ فَٱرْتَقِبْهُمْ وَٱصْطَبِرْ
englishTranslationText: “We	shall	send	a	she-camel	to	test	them,	therefore	O	Saleh,	wait	and	have	patience.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Hum	nāqa	bhejne	wāle	haiñ	unki	jānch	ko	to	aey	Sāleh!	Tu	rāh	dekh	aur	sabr	kar

arabicText: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلْمَآءَ قِسْمَةٌۢ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍۢ مُّحْتَضَرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“And	inform	them	that	the	water	is	to	be	
shared	between	them;	only	those	may	
come	whose	turn	it	is.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unheiñ	khabar	de	de	ke	pāni	un	meiñ	
hissoñ	se	hai	har	hisse	par	woh	hāzir	ho	
jiski	bāri	hai

arabicText: فَنَادَوْا۟ صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
englishTranslationText:
In	response	they	called	their	companion	–	
he	therefore	caught	and	hamstrung	the	
she-camel.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	apne	sāthi	ko	pukāra	to	us	ne	
lekar	uski	koocheiñ	kāt	deiñ

arabicText: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
englishTranslationText:
So	how	did	My	punishment	turn	out,	and	
My	warnings?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	kaisa	huwa	mera	‘aƶāb		aur	dar	ke	
farmān

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ فَكَانُوا۟ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلْمُحْتَظِرِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	sent	upon	them	a	single	Scream	–	thereupon	they	became	like	the	barrier	
builder’s	residual	dry	trampled	hay.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		hum	ne	un	par	ek	chinghārd	
bheji	jabhi	woh	ho	gaye	jaise	ghera	
banāne	wāle	ki	bachi	huyi	ghās	sookhi	
raundi	huyi

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	indeed	made	the	Qur’an	
easy	to	memorise,	so	is	there	one	who	
would	remember?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hum	ne	āasān	kiya	Qur’ān	
yād	karne	ke	liye	to	hai	koi	yād	karne	
wāla.

arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
englishTranslationText:
The	people	of	Lut	denied	the	Noble	
Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Lūt	ki	qaum	ne	Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlaya

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍۢ ۖ نَّجَّيْنَـٰهُم بِسَحَرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	sent	a	shower	of	stones	upon	
them,	except	the	family	of	Lut;	We	
rescued	them	before	dawn.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	hum	ne	un	par	pathrā	bheja	
siwaye	Lūt	ke	ghar	waloñ	ke	hum	ne	
unheiñ	pichhle	paher	bachā	liya

arabicText: نِّعْمَةًۭ مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَن شَكَرَ
englishTranslationText:
As	a	reward	from	Us;	this	is	how	We	
reward	one	who	gives	thanks.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	pās	ki	ne'mat	farma	kar	hum	yuñ	hi	
sila	dete	haiñ	usey	jo	shukr	kare

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَنذَرَهُم بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا۟ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	he	had	warned	them	of	Our	
seizure	-	in	response	they	doubted	the	
warnings.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		us	ne	unheiñ	hamāri	girift	se	
darāya	to	unhoñ	ne	dar	ke	farmānoñ	meiñ	
shak	kiya

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِۦ فَطَمَسْنَآ أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	tried	to	persuade	him	regarding	
his	guests	-	We	therefore	blinded	their	
eyes,	“So	taste	My	punishment,	and	My	
warnings.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unhoñ	ne	usey	uske	mehmānoñ	se	
phuslāna	chāha	to	hum	ne	unki	āañkheiñ	
met	deiñ	(Bilkul	mitā	deiñ)	farmāya	
chakho	mera	‘aƶāb	aur	dar	ke	farmān

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُم بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌۭ مُّسْتَقِرٌّۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed,	the	everlasting	punishment	
overcame	them	early	in	the	morning.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		subah	tadke	(Subah	sawere)	
un	par	thaherne	wāla	‘aƶāb		āaya

arabicText: فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
englishTranslationText: “So	taste	My	punishment,	and	My	warnings!”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	chakho	mera	‘aƶāb		aur	dar	ke	farmān

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	We	have	indeed	made	the	Qur’an	easy	to	memorise,	so	is	there	one	who	would	remember?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak		hum	ne	āasān	kiya	Qur’ān	yād	karne	ke	liye	to	hai	koi	yād	karne	wāla

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	the	Noble	Messengers	came	to	the	people	of	Firaun.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak		fir'aun	waloñ		ke	pās	Rasool	āaye

arabicText: كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍۢ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
englishTranslationText:
They	denied	all	Our	signs,	We	therefore	seized	them	-	the	seizure	of	the	Most	Honourable,	the	
All	Powerful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unhoñ	ne	hamāri	sab	nishāniyāñ	jhutlayiñ	to	hum	ne	un	par	girift	ki	jo	ek	‘izzat	wāle	aur	azeem	
qudrat	wāle	ki	shān	thi

arabicText: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٌۭ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
englishTranslationText: Are	your	disbelievers	better	than	they	were,	or	have	you	been	given	exemption	in	the	Books?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kya	tumhāre	kāfir	un	se	behtar	haiñ	ya	kitābon	meiñ	tumhāri	chhutti	likhi	huyi	hai

arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌۭ مُّنتَصِرٌۭ
englishTranslationText: Or	they	say,	“We	shall	all	take	revenge	as	a	group.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ya	yeh	kehte	haiñ	ke	hum	sab	milkar	badla	le	leñge

arabicText: سَيُهْزَمُ ٱلْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
englishTranslationText: The	group	will	soon	be	routed,	and	will	turn	their	backs	to	flee.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	bhagayi	jāti	hai	yeh	jamāt	aur	peethen	pher	deñge

arabicText: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
englishTranslationText: In	fact	their	promise	is	upon	the	Last	Day	-	and	the	Last	Day	is	very	severe	and	very	bitter!
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	unka	w’ada	qiyamat	par	hai	aur	qiyamat	nihayat	kadi	aur	sakht	kadwi

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ وَسُعُرٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	criminals	are	astray	and	insane.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		mujrim	gumrah	aur	deewāne	haiñ

arabicText: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِى ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا۟ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
englishTranslationText: On	the	day	when	they	are	dragged	upon	their	faces	in	the	fire	-	“Taste	the	heat	of	hell.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	āag		meiñ	apne	moñhoñ	par	ghaseete	jāyeñge	aur	farmāya	jāyega	chakho	dozakh	ki	āñch

arabicText: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقْنَـٰهُ بِقَدَرٍۢ
englishTranslationText: We	have	indeed	created	all	things	by	a	proper	measure.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		hum	ne	har	cheez	ek	andāze	se	paida	farmayi

arabicText: وَمَآ أَمْرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٌۭ كَلَمْحٍۭ بِٱلْبَصَرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	Our	command	is	only	a	fleeting	one	–	
like	the	batting	of	an	eyelid.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hamāra	kām	to	ek	bāt	ki	bāt	hai	jaise	
palak	mārna

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَآ أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	indeed	destroyed	your	kind,	
so	is	there	one	who	would	ponder?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hum	ne	tumhāri	wazā'	ke	
halāk	kar	diye	to	hai	koi	dhiyān	karne	
wāla

arabicText: وَكُلُّ شَىْءٍۢ فَعَلُوهُ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
englishTranslationText: And	all	what	they	did	is	in	the	Books.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unhoñ	ne	jo	kuch	kiya	sab	kitāboñ	
meiñ	hai

arabicText: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍۢ وَكَبِيرٍۢ مُّسْتَطَرٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	every	small	and	great	thing	is	
recorded.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	har	choti	badi	cheez	likhi	huyi	hai

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍۢ وَنَهَرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	the	pious	are	amidst	Gardens	and	
springs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	parhez-gār	bāghoñ	aur	naher	
meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: فِى مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍۢ مُّقْتَدِرٍۭ
englishTranslationText:
Seated	in	an	assembly	of	the	Truth,	in	the	
presence	of	Allah,	the	Omnipotent	King.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sach	ki	majlis	meiñ	azeem	qudrat	wāle	
bādshah	ke	huzoor.
